headline: Fed rate decision, Oracle earnings: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, December 10, including the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, earnings from companies like Oracle (ORCL), Adobe (ADBE), and Synopsys (SNPS). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Fed Rate Decision, Adobe and Oracle Earnings: Still to Come This Week
summary: The Federal Reserve will unveil its last rate-setting decision of 2025. A few notable earnings are also due, including Broadcom, Oracle and Adobe, plus retailer Costco. Here's what to expect: Today   Earnings: Adobe, Oracle (üéßmore on the AI trade), Synopsys, Vail Resorts   Economic data: Monthly federal data on deficits/surpluses and delayed quarterly employment cost index   Fed decision: The central bank is expected to cut rates by 0.

headline: Tracking the Adobe Narrative as AI Strategy and Analyst Expectations Shift
summary: Adobe's narrative is shifting as analysts nudge their fair value estimates lower, with the target easing from about $450.32 to $447.56 while the discount rate edges up from roughly 8.53% to 8.59% amid rising uncertainty around the long term growth path. These tweaks reflect a market that still credits Adobe for strong execution and promising AI momentum, but is increasingly cautious about how quickly and durably revenue can grow from here. Long range revenue growth assumptions are trimming...

headline: Adobe Investors Want More Signs AI Is Driving Growth. Earnings Will Give Insight.
summary: Adobe  earnings will provide more updates to investors who want to see the software platform grow in a competitive market as artificial intelligence becomes more prevalent in the creative space.  Adobe  is scheduled to report fiscal fourth-quarter results after the stock market closes on Wednesday.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect the creative software company to report adjusted earnings of $5.40 a share on revenue of $6.11 billion.

content.title: Adobe Investors Want More Signs AI Is Driving Growth. Earnings Will Give Insight.
content.summary: Adobe  earnings will provide more updates to investors who want to see the software platform grow in a competitive market as artificial intelligence becomes more prevalent in the creative space.  Adobe  is scheduled to report fiscal fourth-quarter results after the stock market closes on Wednesday.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect the creative software company to report adjusted earnings of $5.40 a share on revenue of $6.11 billion.

headline: Adobe Expects Double-Digit Recurring Revenue Growth Next Year

headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.39 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $6.19 billion in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $6.1 billion.

content.title: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.39 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $6.19 billion in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $6.1 billion.

headline: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations, Guides For 9.4% Growth Next Year
summary: Creative software giant Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 10.5% year on year to $6.19 billion. Guidance for next quarter‚Äôs revenue was better than expected at $6.28 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts‚Äô estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.50 per share was 1.9% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

content.title: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations, Guides For 9.4% Growth Next Year
content.summary: Creative software giant Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 10.5% year on year to $6.19 billion. Guidance for next quarter‚Äôs revenue was better than expected at $6.28 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts‚Äô estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.50 per share was 1.9% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

headline: Adobe forecasts annual revenue above estimates
summary: Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue above Wall Street expectations ‚Äãon Wednesday, signaling strong demand ‚Äåfor the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing ‚Äåmonetization for its artificial intelligence offerings. Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, Adobe ‚Äçhas made heavy bets on generative AI with its Firefly tool, which can be integrated ‚Äãacross the company's Creative Cloud¬†suite ‚Äåto create images and videos, in an attempt to draw users in. The forecast could potentially allay some investor ‚Äçfears that ‚Å†Adobe's rate of AI monetization would leave the software giant trailing Figma ‚Å†and other newer players in the market.

content.title: Adobe forecasts annual revenue above estimates
content.summary: Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue above Wall Street expectations ‚Äãon Wednesday, signaling strong demand ‚Äåfor the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing ‚Äåmonetization for its artificial intelligence offerings. Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, Adobe ‚Äçhas made heavy bets on generative AI with its Firefly tool, which can be integrated ‚Äãacross the company's Creative Cloud¬†suite ‚Äåto create images and videos, in an attempt to draw users in. The forecast could potentially allay some investor ‚Äçfears that ‚Å†Adobe's rate of AI monetization would leave the software giant trailing Figma ‚Å†and other newer players in the market.

headline: Adobe Reports Record Q4 and FY2025 Revenue
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 10, 2025--Adobe (Nasdaq:ADBE), the global technology leader that unleashes creativity and productivity for individuals and businesses through innovative platforms and tools, today reported financial results for its fourth quarter and FY2025 ended Nov. 28, 2025.

content.title: Adobe Reports Record Q4 and FY2025 Revenue
content.summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 10, 2025--Adobe (Nasdaq:ADBE), the global technology leader that unleashes creativity and productivity for individuals and businesses through innovative platforms and tools, today reported financial results for its fourth quarter and FY2025 ended Nov. 28, 2025.
